title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: We're following NFL signings, trades and cuts for 2025 free agency, including news around Najee Harris.

title: Sources: Texans acquire Eagles' Gardner-Johnson
content: The Texans are acquiring safety C.J. Gardner-Johnson from the Eagles in exchange for former first-round pick Kenyon Green, sources tell ESPN. The two teams will also swap a pair of draft picks in the deal.

title: Vikings add Allen, Fries to strengthen both lines
content: The Vikings strengthened their defensive and offensive lines Tuesday, agreeing to deals with free agent defensive tackle Jonathan Allen and guard Will Fries.

title: Redick riled up as limping Lakers fall to Nets
content: Los Angeles star Luka Doncic logged his second triple-double with his new club, posting 22 points, 12 assists and 12 rebounds, but he also had five turnovers as the short-handed Lakers fell to the Brooklyn Nets 111-108 on Monday night at Barclays Center.

title: Busy Giants add Holland to defense, sources say
content: The Giants agreed with safety Jevon Holland on a three-year deal worth $45 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: 49ers to release Juszczyk after 8 seasons
content: The 49ers informed Pro Bowl fullback Kyle Juszczyk on Monday night that he is being released, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Yankees ace Cole will have Tommy John surgery
content: On Tuesday in Los Angeles, Yankees right-hander Gerrit Cole will undergo Tommy John surgery, the team announced, ending his season before it began and leaving New York staggering from another blow as it prepares to defend its American League pennant.

title: Sources: Ex-Jets, Broncos QB Wilson to Dolphins
content: Free agent quarterback Zach Wilson reached agreement with the Dolphins on a one-year, $6 million, fully guaranteed deal that could grow to $10 million.

title: Man Utd to leave Old Trafford for new stadium
content: Manchester United have officially announced plans to leave Old Trafford, their home for more than 100 years, and move into a new stadium.

title: Men's Bracketology: Auburn stays No. 1; Gonzaga's WCC semifinal win keeps them in the hunt
content: Auburn has lost back-to-back games but is still positioned for the top overall seed as automatic bids begin coming off the table.

title: 'He's got it': An oral history of the NBA's COVID-19 shutdown -- and how it changed sports forever
content: On the fifth anniversary of the night the NBA shut down, ESPN reveals how it happened, down to the minute -- told by the players, executives, politicians, doctors and journalists who were there.

title: Women's Bracketology: Gonzaga upset, likely to miss NCAA tournament for first time since 2016
content: The 1-seeds and top 16 are set. But a trio of upsets to No. 1 conference seeds sent shock waves throughout the rest of the bracket.

title: A 40-year-old throwing 94.5 mph? A .696 batting average!? Spring training numbers we do (and don't) believe in
content: It's hard to know which stats to trust this time of year. So we dig in to separate what's real from the March mirages.

title: Olney: Yankees must replace Gerrit Cole -- but they'll probably have to wait
content: Fans might want a big splash after New York lost its ace, but the right fit emerging could be months away.

title: NHL playoff watch: Who will make the Eastern Conference finals?
content: The Hurricanes and Lightning both have good shots, and they face off Tuesday on ESPN+. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: The ACC is on track for its fewest men's NCAA tournament bids in 25 years -- what's next?
content: The storied college basketball conference is in flux, but it's banking on an injection of money and young wave of coaches to carry it into this new era.

title: Sources: Rams to release Kupp if no trade made
content: The Los Angeles Rams plan to release wide receiver Cooper Kupp when the NFL's new season starts March 12 if they are unable to find a trade partner, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Sources: Darnold to Seahawks on $100.5M deal
content: The Seahawks found their replacement for Geno Smith, agreeing to a 3-year, $100.5 million deal with QB Sam Darnold, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Eagles trading QB Pickett to Browns
content: The Eagles are trading quarterback Kenny Pickett to the Browns for a 2025 fifth-round pick and quarterback Dorian Thompson-Robinson, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Sources: Bills bolster receiving corps with Palmer
content: The Bills have reached agreement with former Chargers wide receiver Joshua Palmer on a three-year, $36 million deal, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Panthers' Horn gets historic deal for DB
content: Jaycee Horn has reached a four-year deal that averages $25 million per season, making him the highest-paid defensive back in NFL history, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Lions to sign CB Reed to replace Davis
content: The Detroit Lions have agreed to a three-year, $48 million contract with free agent cornerback D.J. Reed, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Chiefs sign OL Moore for 2 years, $30M
content: The Chiefs have agreed to a two-year, $30 million contract with four-year veteran tackle Jaylon Moore, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Godwin returns to Bucs on 3-year deal
content: Chris Godwin, who had the most receptions through the first seven weeks of the 2024 season before getting hurt, has reached a deal with the Bucs, the team said.

title: Juan Soto first OF pick in last mock before Opening Day
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2025, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

title: Man United's new stadium will be big, but it won't be world's biggest football ground
content: Manchester United's proposed new 100,000-seat home will be one of the world's largest soccer stadiums, but it won't be the biggest.

title: Liverpool's No. 1 conundrum: Alisson or Kelleher to make way for Mamardashvili?
content: It's a good problem to have, but Arne Slot must decide which goalkeeper will be Liverpool's No. 1 next season.

title: Fernandes: Utd want to recreate Sporting success
content: Manchester United are still believing that coach Ruben Amorim will replicate the success he had at Sporting CP, club captain Bruno Fernandes said.

title: Ratcliffe backs Amorim, at United 'for a long time'
content: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has given his backing to manager Ruben Amorim and said the Portuguese coach will remain at the club "for a long time."

title: Slot: PSG 'most complete' team Liverpool faced
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has said his team will need to deliver their best performance of the season against Paris Saint-Germain if they are to book their place in the quarterfinals of the Champions League.

title: Robinson wants Fulham stay amid reports of move
content: United States star Antonee Robinson has told ESPN he is ignoring speculation over his future and wants to play in European competitions with Fulham.

title: Ronaldo, Duran send Al Nassr to ACL quarterfinals
content: Al Nassr's Jhon Duran scored twice and Cristiano Ronaldo netted a penalty as the Saudi Pro League side booked a place in the Asian Champions League Elite last eight on Monday with a 3-0 win over Iran's Esteghlal.

title: Santi, Jiménez lead Mexico Nations League squad
content: Mexico national team head coach Javier Aguirre announced the 23-player roster for the upcoming Concacaf Nations League matches during the March international window, with Raul Jimenez and Santiago Gimenez headlining the squad.

title: PSG's Kvaratskhelia: Anfield trip 'most important'
content: Paris Saint-Germain forward Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has described his team's visit to Anfield in the Champions League as the "most important" game of their season.

title: Fury, Rooney to manage England Soccer Aid side
content: Former heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury and ex-Manchester United and England forward Wayne Rooney will join forces to co-manage the England Soccer Aid side at Old Trafford in June.

title: NWSL ambition rankings: Who is No. 1 in 2025 when it comes to raising the game?
content: With the 2025 NWSL season kicking off this weekend, it's time to unveil our second annual ambition rankings. Which teams are leading the way and who is just trying to keep up?

title: Ferrari's debut winners: Can Lewis Hamilton join list of legends?
content: Some of the biggest names in F1 history have won in their debuts with Ferrari, a feat Lewis Hamilton will look to replicate on Sunday in Australia.

title: Chempoovam trees offer a visual treat at Kuttikkanam
content: These trees offer an amazing spectacle during the sprouting season of new leaves. They are easily recognizable due to their  unusual appearance

title: Reforms are bringing in private participation in space research, says ISRO chairman
content: V. Narayanan, who is also Secretary, Department of Space, was delivering his convocation speech at the Central University of Karnataka

title: Assam will deploy satellites to track illegal migrants, drug trade, wildlife: CM Sarma
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said at least five small satellites would be positioned in space for real time State-specific data

title: Row erupts in West Bengal after ex-BJP worker accuses Trinamool leader of rape
content: BJP stages protests seeking arrest of the accused; Trinamool leader Lakshman Sit says it is a conspiracy to defame him

title: Discussion raises concerns over draft UGC regulations of 2025 and impact on State autonomy
content: Regulations would undermine the constitutional rights of States over higher education institutions, says Higher Education Minister R. Bindu

title: Pakistan Passenger Train Hijacked, Rebel Group Claims Hundreds Of Hostages
content: The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) which seeks independence for Balochistan from Pakistan in a statement said it took control of a train and kept the passengers hostage.

title: Court Orders Case Against Arvind Kejriwal Over Alleged Public Fund Misuse
content: In a fresh setback for Arvind Kejriwal, a court in the capital has directed that a first information report (FIR) be registered against him and others from the AAP over allegedly misusing public funds to put up large hoardings.

title: Rs 1200 Crore Embezzled From Trust That Runs Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital
content: The Trust that runs Mumbai's prestigious Lilavati Hospital has alleged that funds to the tune of Rs 1200 crore has been siphoned off by its former trustees. The Lilavati Kirtilal Mehta Medical Trust has complained to the police and Enforcement Direct

title: Airtel Ties Up With Elon Musk's SpaceX To Bring Starlink Internet In India
content: Airtel announced an agreement with Elon Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink's high-speed internet services to its customers in India.

title: Pakistan Left Red-Faced As Its Senior Diplomat Deported By US Despite Visa
content: In a major embarrassment for Pakistan, a senior diplomat was denied entry into the US despite having a valid visa and necessary documents, reported The News, a Pakistani media outlet.

title: Video: Inside Armoured Vehicle, Jawans Push Through Attacks In Manipur
content: An armoured vehicle of the central security forces came under heavy attacks by protesters from the Kuki tribes in Manipur on the first day of the Centre's order to ensure free movement of people in the crisis-hit state.

title: Saudi Arabia's Mega-City Faces Mega Problem: The Price Of A Desert Paradise
content: Private yachts were moored nearby, and some of the biggest celebrities were in attendance as Saudi Arabia partially opened Neom, its ambitious $500 billion mega-city in the desert.

title: Chair In Hand, Tongue Sticking Out: Trudeau's Parliament Exit Is Viral
content: After resigning as Prime Minister of Canada, Justin Trudeau was captured exiting Parliament in a playful style -- carrying a chair and with his tongue sticking out.

title: Wasim Akram Loses Cool During Live Show Over Champions Trophy Ceremony Row
content: Wasim Akram admitted being stunned on failing to spot a single PCB official at the ICC Champions Trophy presentation ceremony.

title: Man Dangles From Train Window While Performing Stunt, Rescued By Passengers
content: The incident has sparked widespread outrage and raised serious concerns about safety and the reckless pursuit of online fame.

title: Gavaskar Ends CT 2025 'Unfair Advantage' Talks, Says "England Didn't Win..."
content: Legendary Indian cricket team batter Sunil Gavaskar ended the debate over India enjoying any kind of 'unfair advantage' during their Champions Trophy 2025 campaign.

title: Ex-Facebook COO Told Assistant To "Come To Bed" On Private Jet, Claims Book
content: Former Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg spent $13,000 (Rs 11.3 lakh) on lingerie for herself and her 26-year-old female assistant on a trip to Europe, a new memoir has claimed.

title: NDTV Explains Nepal's 'Return Of The King' Movement. A Hindu Monarchy Again?
content: Nearly seventeen years ago - on May 28, 2008, to be exact - Nepal abolished a 239-year-old Hindu monarchy. On Sunday, over 10,000 campaigned for it to be restored.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: Mayawati calls for prioritizing law and order, criticizes misuse of officials
content: Pointing to the clashing occasions of Holi and Friday prayers during Ramzan, the former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister made a push for respect towards all religions and urged the State government and the administrative apparatus to promote brotherhood instead of politicizing the matter.

title: Row over P.C. George’s remarks about love jihad intensifies
content: Police have received three complaints against him over his remarks. Officials say they are awaiting instructions from higher authorities on whether or not to file a fresh case against him

title: Parliamentary panel to launch website to invite suggestions on simultaneous polls
content: BJP leader P.P. Chaudhary said a presentation of the website was organised for panel members and the Committee will also issue an advertisement inviting memoranda from across the country on simultaneous elections

title: Praja Arogya Vedika opposes government’s PPP model for medical colleges
content: The NGO  said privatisation of medical education will compromise people’s Right to Health and lead to increased costs

title: Kerala teen dies after following extreme diet plan
content: She reportedly died of severe anorexia nervosa, a phsychiatric condition, in which individuals lose the natural reflex for hunger and thirst

title: Wrestlers free to challenge Centre revoking WFI suspension: Delhi HC
content: The court also requested the single judge Bench hearing the plea by the wrestlers against the 2023 WFI election to expedite the proceedings.

title: Focus on promoting native crop varieties
content: The former Vice-Chancellor of UAS, Dharwad, R.R. Hanchinal has stressed on the need for making consumers aware of the significance of such crops

title: Trees cut in private estate in Coonoor with permits, says Nilgiris DFO
content: The private estate had sought and obtained permission from the district committee for the cutting of 47 “matured” jackfruit trees within their estate

title: MP urges Centre to set up Coconut Board regional office in Rajamahendravaram
content: Andhra Pradesh is the fourth largest State cultivating coconut but the farmers are suffering in the absence of timely services and advice, says Purandeswari in the Lok Sabha

title: Classify Cancer as a notifiable disease to succeed in fighting it: Dr. Dattatreyudu Nori
content: The Andhra Pradesh government appointed eminent oncologist Dr. Dattatreyudu  Nori as Government Advisor on cancer care on Monday. In an exclusive interaction with The Hindu, Dr. Dattatreyudu, while sharing his views on cancer care in India and abroad, stresses the need for classifying cancer as a notifiable disease. He says it helps prepare a  ‘Cancer Atlas’, which should show cancer information for every district and State in India to address the problem. Following are the excerpts from the interview:

title: Opposition protests delimitation, duplicate EPICs, forcing adjournment in Rajya Sabha
content: 18 notices seeking a debate on duplicate voter card numbers rejected by chair; protests pause to allow DMK MP to raise concerns about delimitation, termed a “grave threat” to federal democracy

title: Kerala Centre for Disease Control to be launched in April-May
content: It will focus on disease prevention with 14 divisions and a public health emergency operation unit with AI-based forecasting for public health emergencies.

title: Tiger spotted at human habitation in Idukki’s Granby, Forest department to set up cage
content: Forest dept. team is camping in the area. Residents demand that the department capture the animal and shift it from the area

title: Minor girls recruited by extremists rescued in Manipur
content: In January, the Manipur Commission for Protection of Child Rights expressed concern over reports of armed groups using children as fighters

title: Government bans Mirwaiz’s Awami Action Committee, Jammu and Kashmir Ittihadul Muslimeen for 5 years
content: Considering all the facts available, the MHA declared both groups outlawed for five years under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967, according to the notifications.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Kudumbashree takes active role in Vijnana Kerala campaign to upskill youth to get employment
content: Mission’s community ambassadors are reaching out to 1.5 lakh jobseekers who have registered on the Digital Workforce Management System and making them aware of the employment opportunities available

title: Padmakumar moderates his voice, to toe party line
content: Padmakumar acknowledges that airing his grievances publicly was a mistake and expressed his willingness to accept any disciplinary action from the party.

title: Macherla gets ₹600 crore under Jal Jeevan Mission: TDP MLA
content: Macherla town also needed funds for drinking water and the State government assured to provide them, the Legislator said

title: Telangana sanctions ₹540 crore for restoration of heritage structures, new buildings construction at Chakali Ilamma Univ in Hyderabad
content: The main entrance to the university located abutting the Musi river would be reopened reopen it once the Musi rejuvenation project was completed

title: Delhi Court directs registration of FIR against Arvind Kejriwal for ‘misusing’ public money
content: The complaint filed in 2019 alleged that Mr. Kejriwal, two other AAP leaders “deliberately misused public money by putting up large-sized hoardings”

title: Airtel signs distribution pact to bring Starlink to India
content: The agreement would be contingent on Starlink receiving requisite approvals to begin operations in India

title: Telangana Govt to provide ₹3 lakh each to 5 lakh youth for self-employment under Rajiv Yuva Vikasam
content: Notification pertaining to Rajiv Yuva Vikasam will be issued on March 15 and unemployed youth could apply for the scheme online till April 5

title: Hampi rape case: Karnataka government issues guidelines for tourist safety, police permission mandatory for trips to deserted spots
content: If homestay or resort owners want to take their domestic or international guests to the outskirts or deserted places, they should inform the jurisdictional police and obtain their permission, say the guidelines

title: Three-day fair in Chikkamagaluru: District administration imposes restrictions on vehicles, visit by tourists
content: Tourists will not be allowed to visit Mullayyanagiri, Seethalayyanagiri, Galikere, Bababudangiri and Manikyadhara on the three days

title: States with successful family planning to lose seats in delimitation: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: Nine States may lose anywhere between one to eight Lok Sabha seats each, while States like U.P. and Bihar are going to gain 11 and 10 seats, respectively

title: Gang of five caught with ganja near Rajamahendravaram Airport
content: The police traced the movements of the vehicle in which the gang was transporting 150 kilograms of ganja toward Vijayawada City on the National Highway

title: Academicians propose name of Dr. V.K.R.V. Rao for Bengaluru City University instead of former PM Manmohan Singh
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, in his budget for 2025-26, proposed to rename Bangalore City University as Dr. Manmohan Singh Bengaluru City University

title: BSF seized ₹461 crore of contraband on India-Bangladesh border in 2024, highest in 10 years: Government
content: The data provided by the Union Home Ministry showed that since 2015, the BSF has seized contraband items worth ₹2,806.17 crore at the border — of which goods worth ₹461.07 crore have been seized in 2024 alone

title: SCCL signs pact with BHEL for setting up 800 MW thermal power plant near Jaipur in Mancherial in 40 months
content: On completion, the new plant is expected to contribute ₹300 cr. p.a. profit to SCCL in addition to ₹450 cr p.a. being contributed by existing 1,200 MW project

title: Outreach: ECI proposes meeting with parties to improve electoral processes
content: ECI said it has invited suggestions from all national and State political parties by April 30 for "any unresolved issues" at the level of electoral registration officers, district election officers and chief electoral officers.

title: BJD to participate in meeting convened by Stalin on delimitation
content: Seven States, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Odisha and Punjab will be directly affected by the delimitation, says DMK leader Dayanidhi Maran, who met former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik in Bhubaneswar

title: India's Got Latent row: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani appear before NCW
content: The Commission had taken serious note of the vulgar and offensive remarks made by Ranveer Allahbadia, Apoorva Makhija, Samay Raina, Jaspreet Singh and Mr. Chanchlani on the show and summoned them as well as Tushar Poojari and Saurabh Bothra

title: BJP leader suggests Muslim men wear 'tarpaulin hijabs' on Holi
content: Raghuraj Singh said Holi is a matter of faith for 'Sanatan Dharma' and revellers cannot be asked to throw colours within a specific range

title: Watch: Why are Southern States resisting Hindi more than others
content: In this video, the Hindu Data Team dives into the core issues that keep reigniting the language debate in one form or another

title: It’s frequent flier time, people of Manipur continue to wait for visit: Congress’ dig at PM Modi
content: The Opposition party claimed that the Prime Minister's "refusal" to visit Manipur for almost two years is really an insult to the people of Manipur

title: No peace in Manipur at gunpoint, urge PM Modi to visit State: Gaurav Gogoi
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi criticises Centre’s approach in Manipur, urges PM Modi to visit and listen to people’s concerns

title: Opened fire, blew up track: How militants hijacked train in Balochistan
content: A passenger train in Balochistan, Pakistan, was attacked by separatist militants, injuring the driver and resulting in a hostage situation involving over 100 passengers. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility, demanding the withdrawal of security forces to release the hostages. The train was derailed after the militants blew up the railway track.

title: $125bn gone in a day: Musk quotes Python to shrug off Tesla rout, X outages
content: Elon Musk faced significant setbacks on March 10, with Tesla's stock plummeting by over 15% and his social media platform X experiencing major outages. The twin crises coincided with market panic and increasing criticism of Musk's political ties to Trump's administration. Additionally, Tesla's declining sales and growing competition, particularly from China's BYD, compound the challenges.

title: 'All concerns to be resolved': EC to TMC over EPIC number, other issues
content: The Election Commission of India has assured the Trinamool Congress that concerns about duplicate EPIC numbers, dead voters, and illegal migrants will be resolved. TMC MP Sagarika Ghose highlighted the seriousness of duplicate EPIC cards and the need for transparency. The opposition demanded discussion on voter list irregularities, stressing their importance for democracy and the Constitution.

title: Apple loses $174bn in one day as Microsoft, Google lost $750bn on Manic Monday
content: Apple, Microsoft, Tesla, Nvidia, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta suffered significant losses in market value, totaling over $750 billion on Monday, driven by concerns around new tariffs impacting tech companies. Apple alone shed $174 billion, and Tesla saw a 15% drop in stock value, its worst since 2020. The technology sector faces escalating trade tensions and economic uncertainty.

title: 'Mishra pushed me': BJP, Cong engage in scuffle in Odisha assembly - watch
content: The Odisha assembly descended into chaos as BJP and Congress leaders engaged in a scuffle, with accusations of physical altercation. The unrest began during question hour when senior BJP lawmaker Jaynarayan Mishra allegedly pushed Congress MLA Taraprasad Bahinipati. Speaker Surama Padhy allowed proceedings to continue despite the turmoil.

title: Airtel partners with Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink to India
content: Airtel and SpaceX have partnered to bring Starlink’s high-speed internet to India. This collaboration aims to extend connectivity to rural regions and support businesses, schools, and communities. They will explore offering Starlink equipment in Airtel retail stores and using Airtel’s infrastructure to enhance the service. SpaceX’s direct offerings will also benefit from Airtel's market expertise.

title: SBI down: Issue affecting mobile banking, UPI & other services ‘stands resolved’
content: SBI faced technical issues that disrupted online and mobile banking services, with the problems peaking in the afternoon. The bank acknowledged the issue and by 5 PM, services were restored. Users shared their experiences on social media, with some posting memes about the disruptions. SBI apologized for the inconvenience caused to its customers.

title: Saudi Arabia rebrands as mediator for global crises
content: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is hosting global leaders to mediate conflicts, including Ukraine's President Zelenskyy discussing Russia's war with him. Riyadh is positioning itself as a neutral mediator, balancing relationships with the US, Russia, and other nations, while aiming to leverage influence in Middle Eastern conflicts and boost foreign investments.

title: How Musk's spat with Poland FM led to jump in stock of Europe's Starlink rival
content: Eutelsat's stock skyrocketed nearly 390% last week due to speculation it may replace SpaceX's Starlink in Ukraine. The French satellite company is exploring an expanded role in Ukraine and is negotiating with the EU to bolster internet services. Relations between the US and Ukraine worsened after a failed meeting between their leaders.

title: Uproar in Rajya Sabha over Kharge's 'thokenge' remark; Congress chief clarifies
content: A ruckus erupted in Rajya Sabha after BJP objected to Mallikarjun Kharge's remarks. Union minister JP Nadda condemned the language used. Kharge apologised and clarified his remarks were against government policy, not the Chair. This followed a heated exchange over remarks made by Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan about the Tamil Nadu government and DMK.

title: Pakistani envoy denied entry to US, deported despite a valid visa: Report
content: The United States denied entry and deported Pakistani ambassador to Turkmenistan, KK Ahsan Wagan, from Los Angeles due to an 'immigration objection.' The Pakistani Foreign Ministry is investigating the incident, which has raised diplomatic concerns, and Wagan is likely to be recalled to Islamabad for clarification.

title: Big B finalises another land of 54,454 sqft in Ayodhya
content: Kareena Kapoor Khan embraces aging and addresses societal pressures on actors. Aamir Khan and Ranbir Kapoor might team up for Nitesh Tiwari's next project. Govinda reflects on his nine-year legal battle after slapping a fan. Amitabh Bachchan acquires land in Ayodhya to build a memorial for his father.

title: Kerala CSR funds scam: Ananda Kumar taken into custody after bail plea rejected
content: Ananda Kumar shifted to a hospital for medical examination after he informed Crime Branch that he was undergoing treatment for some ailments

title: Garimella Balakrishna Prasad departs with State honours in Tirupati
content: Tirupati Collector S. Venkateswar paid his respects to the body, while gun-wielding policemen offered salute as per protocol

title: Days after praising Aurangzeb, Abu Azmi pays tribute to Sambhaji Maharaj
content: "On the martyrdom day of the second Chhatrapati of Swarajya, the valiant warrior, Dharmveer Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, I pay my humble tribute," Mr. Azmi wrote on X

title: History-sheeter murdered in Kancheepuram
content: A senior official of the Kancheepuram police said Vasoolraja had over 20 criminal cases pending against him, including attempt-to-murder, robbery, and theft cases

title: India, U.S. to increase market access, cut tariff, non-tariff barriers, says government
content: In a written reply to the Lok Sabha, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Jitin Prasada said that as on date, reciprocal tariffs have not been imposed by the U.S. on India.

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Rajya Sabha witnesses uproar over Kharge's unparliamentary expression
content: Kharge immediately apologised for his comments, and also clarified that it was not meant for the Chair but for government policies

title: Police arrest two in case of dead infant found in Kaikalur Government Hospital
content: The accused had repeatedly sexually assaulted the minor mother of the infant whose body was found in  the toilet of the government hospital, police said

title: Widespread rainfall in Tamil Nadu on March 11; heavy rain likely in three south T.N. districts on March 12
content: Residents of Chennai city and surroundings can expect light to moderate rain with thunderstorm and lightning on March 12

title: Stalin commends DMK MPs for ‘fighting spirit’ in Lok Sabha; reiterates T.N.’s opposition to NEP
content: “We will not accept the ‘Nagpur plan’ capable of causing great destruction,” the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister said

title: Andhra Pradesh to retrieve ancient records, modernize libraries: Minister Lokesh
content: We will explore Central government funding and expedite the digitization of records from the Oriental Manuscript Library. The pending district gazettes will also be retrieved, the Minister said in the Assembly

title: Pay salary, benefits to consumer body members sans delay: Supreme Court to States
content: In case there was no decision from the Government of India on the prospective amendment, the Court said, it would “consider exercising power under Article 142 of the constitution”

title: Bill to streamline service related to immigration, foreigners introduced in Lok Sabha
content: Nityanand Rai asserted that while tourists were welcome to come to India, it was the government's responsibility to ensure peace and sovereignty of the nation remain intact.

title: Police launch search for two boys missing from Jammu’s Kathua
content: On March 8, the bodies of three civilians, including a 14-year-old child, were found in Billawar area in Kathua

title: Amaravati construction to cost ₹64,721 crore, completion in 3 years: Minister Narayana
content: The Minister criticised former Chief Minister Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy for his shifting stance on the development of Amravati

title: Balloon sellers from Rajasthan arrested for house break theft in Bengaluru
content: They would zero in on a house that was locked. While two of them would enter the house by breaking open the lock, the third one would keep a watch outside, police said

title: Bihar jewellery heist: Armed robbers, hostage situation, high-speed chase, and gunfight
content: Bhojpur police quickly responded to a Rs 24-crore jewellery heist in Ara town, resulting in a high-speed chase, a gunfight, and the arrest of two suspects. Two bags of stolen jewellery worth Rs 15 crore were recovered, while a manhunt is underway for four other robbers.

title: Don't follow 'hearsay' crack diets: Dietician
content: A Kerala teen died after following a 'water diet'. This highlights the need for scientific diets and expert advice. Many people follow dangerous, unverified diets to lose weight quickly. Improper diets can cause severe health issues like fatigue, dehydration, and anorexia nervosa. Consulting experts and balancing diet with exercise is crucial for maintaining health.

title: Dalai Lama declares successor will be born outside China; Beijing counters
content: The Dalai Lama's new book reveals his successor will be born outside China, challenging Beijing's control over Tibet's spiritual leadership. Beijing rejects his statement, insisting it has the authority to select the next Dalai Lama. The Dalai Lama emphasizes the importance of continuing his mission and the Tibetan people's aspiration for freedom.

title: India Post celebrates Champions Trophy win with postal marking
content: This special cancellation, which celebrates India's victory in the prestigious tournament, was released at the Mumbai General Post Office (GPO).

title: 'Motherhood not a liability': How Koneru Humpy balances chess and family
content: Koneru Humpy, India's top woman chess player, balances motherhood and her career with grace. After a hiatus, she made a strong comeback, winning the 2019 World Rapid Championship. Humpy's commitment to fitness and mental strength drives her success. As she prepares for upcoming tournaments, her calm determination and supportive family continue to inspire.

title: 'Children poisoned': Couple, 2 kids found dead at Hyderabad home
content: Four family members, including a couple and their two teenage children, were found dead in their Habsiguda residence on Monday night. Police suspect the parents poisoned their children before taking their own lives, potentially due to financial distress, and have registered a case of suspicious death.

title: Garden watering, making microbes: What kept Sunita Williams busy in space?
content: Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams, who has been on the ISS since June 2024, conducted extensive scientific research, broke the spacewalking record, and contributed to various experiments including plant growth and microbial studies. She is set to return to Earth with fellow astronaut Butch Wilmore and cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov.

title: 'Dragged out, shot at point-blank': Syria on edge as rebels go on a revenge spree
content: Syria plunges into renewed violence after the fall of Bashar al-Assad, with over 1,000 deaths in two days due to sectarian clashes. The insurgent leader Ahmad al-Sharaa's forces are accused of brutal revenge attacks, exacerbating fears of prolonged conflict and instability.

title: Watch: Russia downs 337 Ukrainian drones in 'largest' attack yet
content: Russia's defence ministry reported the downing of 337 Ukrainian drones overnight, marking the largest drone assault on its territory in three years. The strikes impacted ten regions, including significant disruptions in the Moscow area and border regions like Kursk. Kyiv has yet to comment.

title: Ranya Rao case: K'taka govt orders probe into ‘misuse’ of protocol service at airport
content: Home Minister G Parameshwara announced an inquiry into the alleged misuse of police protocol services at Kempegowda International Airport following accusations of involvement in a gold smuggling racket. This comes after Sandalwood actor Ranya Rao, daughter of a top police official, was caught with 14.2kg of gold at the airport. The issue was heatedly debated in the legislative assembly.

title: Pakistan lodges 'complaint' with ICC for sidelining it
content: According to a report, the PCB has described the incident as a blatant disregard for Pakistan’s role as host and demanded an explanation and assurance against biased treatment.

title: PM Modi in Mauritius: A look back at his 1998 visit to ‘mini India’
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Mauritius highlights the strong historical and cultural ties between the two nations, reinforced by a large Indian-origin population. His engagements included a warm reception by the local diaspora, homage to Mahatma Gandhi, and revisiting significant spiritual sites.

title: 'Take shelter!' Tornado strikes Florida TV station live on air- video
content: A tornado hit Fox 35's station in central Florida during a live broadcast, causing significant damage. Meteorologist Brooks Garner urged colleagues and viewers to take immediate shelter. The storm caused property damage and resulted in a house collapse, though no injuries were reported.

title: Seeman’s security guard, driver move Madras High Court seeking bail
content: Justice Sunder Mohan grants time till Thursday for the prosecution to file its counter affidavit to their bail plea

title: Aligarh chief mufti urges Muslims to ensure cordial atmosphere on Holi
content: Chief mufti of Aligarh Khalid Hameed emphasised that with minor adjustments, the Muslim community could contribute to the peaceful celebration of Holi

title: Kerala seniors avail free treatment under Ayushman Bharat Vay Vandana at Dakshina Kannada hospitals, but Karnataka yet to adopt scheme
content: The Karnataka government had written to the Centre on November 27, 2024, seeking adequate support for implementing ABVV scheme, which provides free treatment to all 70-plus citizens, regardless of their income

title: 'Been out of India for 15 years ...': Lalit Modi denies extradition claims
content: Lalit Modi has dismissed reports of an extradition notice against him as fake news, mentioning his extensive international travels without issue. He also shared an Interpol report denying a Red Corner Notice against him, while Vanuatu's PM stated a zero-tolerance stance towards criminals.

title: Musk's estranged trans daughter claims he used sex-selective IVF
content: Vivian Jenna Wilson, Elon Musk’s estranged daughter, has accused him of using sex-selective IVF, claiming her transgender identity contradicted his expectations. Wilson, who legally changed her name and gender in 2022, has consistently challenged Musk’s narrative about their relationship.

title: Hampi horror: Delhi HR manager died trying to save women from rape
content: Bibhas Nayak, an HR manager and travel enthusiast, tragically died while defending two women from sexual assault in Karnataka. He was thrown into a canal by the attackers. Bibhas is remembered for his bravery and compassionate nature. His family has called for a thorough investigation as they mourn his loss.

title: Memorials, meals and Mercedes: Key takeaways from Maharashtra budget
content: The Budget reveals Maharashtra faces its highest debt projection at Rs 9.3 lakh crore and a revenue deficit of Rs 45,891 crores for 2025-26. With limited financial room, it maintains existing schemes while raising district annual plans and proposes new taxes to generate revenue.

title: Fashion show during Ramzan in J&K; videos pulled down after backlash
content: Fashion models strutted on snow in Gulmarg, and the videos were removed after backlash during Ramadan fasting. J&K chief cleric and others opposed the ‘obscene’ display. Designers apologized and expressed regret for any hurt caused. The controversy reached the J&K assembly, with various leaders voicing their discontent.

title: Exclusive: 'Koi bhi situation mei bhejo, karke aaunga' - Shreyas Iyer
content: Shreyas Iyer celebrated India's Champions Trophy win with an impromptu dance, highlighting his journey through a year of highs and lows. Despite past setbacks, including losing a central contract, he emerged as India's top run-scorer in the tournament, emphasizing his resilience and importance to the team.

title: ICC Champions Trophy: How Varun Chakravarthy evolved to become India’s X-factor
content: India faced a potential setback in the Champions Trophy with Jasprit Bumrah's absence but turned to mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy. Varun delivered outstanding performances, taking five wickets against New Zealand and crucial strikes in knockout matches, helping India win the title. His unique bowling and mental toughness earned praise and made him a key player.

title: Missing Indian student may have drowned while swimming: Cops
content: Indian student Sudiksha Konanki, 20, went missing during a holiday in the Dominican Republic and is believed to have drowned. Authorities are conducting a thorough investigation, including search efforts and reviewing evidence. Her companions were questioned, though no charges have been filed, and the search for her continues.

title: Holi 2025: Correct date, muhurat timings, rituals and all one needs to know
content: Holi 2025 celebrations will occur on March 13th and 14th, starting with Holika Dahan and followed by Rangwali Holi. Holika Dahan symbolizes the victory of good over evil, with rituals carried out around a bonfire. It's advised to use organic colors and play Holi consensually.

title: $4 trillion wiped from US stocks: What's behind market panic
content: US stocks experienced a significant decline on Monday, driven by ongoing tariff disputes and the potential for a federal government shutdown. Key factors include high stock valuations, economic uncertainty, and disappointing corporate earnings. Technology stocks, like Tesla, faced severe losses. Investors are keeping a close watch on inflation reports, interest rate policies, and government actions to stabilize the economy.

title: 'Will buy a new one tomorrow': Trump defends Musk after Tesla shares take a hit
content: US President Donald Trump has voiced support for Elon Musk, praising his contributions to the nation amid claims that 'Radical Left Lunatics' are boycotting Tesla to harm Musk. Trump announced plans to buy a Tesla to show solidarity with Musk, who has been appointed by Trump to head the Department of government efficiency. Critics dub Musk as the unofficial 'Co-President.'

title: Man who foresaw 2008 crash has buy call on India!
content: Jim Walker forecasts a 10% decline in the U.S. dollar by 2025 and expects an economic slowdown, though manageable. He is optimistic about copper's long-term prospects due to green energy demand and strongly recommends increased investment in Indian equities.

content: it's been 17 years since Chris Lofton played for the university of Tennessee . he was one of the most beloved athletes in the history of the university . the former volunteer was a legend for volunteers fans and beyond . but he never felt sorry for himself .

title: Why the Seahawks are taking a risk choosing Sam Darnold as their next QB
content: the seahawks are giving free agent Sam Darnold $55 million in guarantees, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter . the team's top decision-maker was leaving the door cracked for what would be a blockbuster quarterback swap . "we expect him to be our guy," Schneider said .

title: Hyderabad Horror: Crushed By Debt, Couple Kills Children, Dies By Suicide
content: police found four bodies at the home . a couple died by suicide after killing their children - 13 and 10 years old . the couple wrote in a note left behind: "i had no other option but to end my life. Please forgive me"

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah open to Barcelona move
content: Mohamed Salah's representatives have reportedly sounded out Barcelona over a potential move, while Eduardo Camavinga has been added to Manchester City's shortlist . the 32-year-old has been in blistering form for Arne Slot's side this season, notching up 27 goals and 17 assists .
